did.head: Collection Summary

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Republican National Committee (U.S.) Opposition Research Group.

did.abstract: The records include research materials accumulated and acquired by the Republican Opposition Research Group during the 1984 presidential election for use in the campaign against Democratic presidential candidates. The records consist of materials such as clippings, press releases, other printed matter, speeches, debate transcripts, memoranda, and video tapes regarding specific Democratic Party leaders such as Walter F. Mondale, John Glenn and Geraldine Ferraro, and specific political issues and special interest groups.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1985.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Ronald Reagan subject collection, Hoover Institution Archives
Ronald Reagan radio commentary sound recordings, Hoover Institution Archives

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Opposition Research Group operated as part of the Communications Division within the Republican National Committee, chaired by Michael Bayer. The group was formed "in 1984 with its own budget of $1.1 million, to create a master data bank of computerized voter research and opposition research. Staff amassed information on eight Democratic presidential candidates based on data from voting records, Congressional Record speeches, media clippings and transcripts, campaign materials, all of which was stored on a computer for easy access. In this way the party was able to track inconsistencies of its opponents and attack them. This original data base evolved into a network that linked information gleaned by Republicans in all 50 states, creating a master data base accessible to high-ranking Republican staff, even aboard Air Force One when Ronald Reagan was president."
J. M. Bayer & J. Rodota, "Computerized Opposition Research," Campaigns & Elections, 6, p. 26-27.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The records include research materials accumulated and acquired by the Republican Opposition Research Group during the 1984 presidential election for use in the campaign against Democratic presidential candidates. The records consist of materials such as clippings, press releases, other printed matter, speeches, debate transcripts, memoranda, and video tapes regarding specific Democratic Party leaders, such as Walter F. Mondale, John Glenn and Geraldine Ferraro, and specific political issues and special interest groups.

Materials contain information about the Democratic Party presidential and vice-presidential nominees, Walter Mondale and Geraldine Ferraro, including speeches, financial information, and political background and history.

Also present are the records generated by the Opposition Research Group regarding its work, including materials regarding the Republican National Committee's innovative electronic research database and communications system, Voices for Victory, which allowed key members of the Republican Party to maintain constant communication and disseminate information quickly and efficiently regardless of geographic location.

Materials are arranged as they were received from the creator. Materials such as clippings files are arranged chronologically, while other files are arranged alphabetically by topic. Topical folder names created by the organization have been retained.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Presidents--United States--Election 1984.

scopecontent.p: Includes candidate notebooks, speeches, financial records, voting records, campaign literature, and information regarding Mondale's positions and past actions regarding specific issues. The bulk of the materials are Mondale candidate notebooks, which contain photocopies of clippings and other materials related to his political career. Arranged by format

did.unittitle: 1975, Accountability of Power: Towards a Responsible Presidency,

scopecontent.p: Photocopies

did.unittitle: Mondale's speech at the Democratic National Convention accepting the party's nomination,
Republican National Committee reports regarding Mondale,
Mondale briefing book for Congresswoman Lynn Martin,
Letters to Mondale collected from the Lyndon Johnson Library,
Letters to Mondale collected from the Gerald Ford Library,
Mondale Fact Book Vice President Malaise Twenty Years of Walter Mondale,

scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically by topic

Consists of candidate notebooks, financial records, congressional history, and information regarding Ferraro's positions and actions regarding specific issues. Also includes materials regarding her husband John Zaccaro and his financial information. The bulk of the materials are Ferraro's candidate notebooks, which contain photocopies of clippings and other materials related to her political career. Arranged by format

did.unittitle: Biography, family information, and 1978 campaign literature,
My Name Is Geraldine Ferraro by Lee Michael Katz,

scopecontent.p: Paperback volume

did.unittitle: Committee to Elect Ferraro 9th Congressional District, New York,

scopecontent.p: See also Audiovisual file

did.unittitle: Attack themes, issues, and talking points materials,

scopecontent.p: Arranged in chronological order
Includes materials regarding building code violations and other legal and financial documents
Comprised of candidate notebooks, which contain photocopies of clippings and other materials related to his political career, and related documents.
Includes correspondence, reports, memoranda, and material regarding the Voices for Victory media campaign.
Consists of documents on Democratic Party platforms, including general party information. See also Audiovisual file for party debates.

did.unittitle: American for Democratic Candidates, "Democratic Candidates' Issue Position and Voting Records,"

scopecontent.p: Comprised of material directly regarding the presidential and vice-presidential debates. Includes correspondence and memoranda directly referencing the debates and information regarding mock-debates for Ronald Reagan and George H.W. Bush. See also Audiovisual file.
Consists of clippings and related documents on specific organizations and groups that appeared to favor the Democratic Party.

did.unittitle: American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations (AFL-CIO),

scopecontent.p: Includes material on specific special interest groups and other documents and materials collected by the RNC.

scopecontent.p: Photocopies from book

Federal Election Commission records, Democratic Party candidates,
Republican National Committee Public Affairs Department, "The Carter Record,"
Transcript of presentation with at least one unidentified speaker,

scopecontent.p: Contains sound recordings of speeches given by Geraldine Ferraro in 1978, as well as campaign speeches of Geraldine Ferraro and Walter Mondale in 1984.

did.unittitle: "Delibovi vs Ferraro" - Richmond Hill Block Assoc. - FER 108 (Cassette),
"Delibovi vs Ferraro" - St Francis & Ridgeway Prop. - FER 102 (Cassette),
"Delibovi vs Ferraro" - Lionel Club Rich/Hill - FER 105 (Cassette),
"Delibovi vs Ferraro" - Woodhaven Res. Block Assoc. FER 103 (Cassette),
"Delibovi vs Ferraro" - Jackson Heights Comm. Center - FER 110 (Cassette),
"Delibovi vs Ferraro" - Glendale Taxpayers Asso. FER 101 (Cassette),

scopecontent.p: Contains video recordings of speeches given by Walter Mondale and Geraldine Ferraro while campaigning for the presidency in 1984 as well as earlier speeches. Footage of the presidential and vice presidential debates is also included.
